title: Embassy of Ukraine, Rome
text:
The Embassy of Ukraine, Rome is an <a href="embassy">embassy</a> located in <a href="Rome%2C%20Italy">Rome</a>, <a href="Italy">Italy</a>. It is hosts the primary <a href="diplomatic%20mission">diplomatic mission</a> from <a href="Ukraine">Ukraine</a> to the <a href="Italian%20Republic">Italian Republic</a>. It is also concurrently accredited to the <a href="Republic%20of%20San%20Marino">Republic of San Marino</a> and the <a href="Republic%20of%20Malta">Republic of Malta</a>.
History of Diplomatic Relations Between Ukraine and Italy.
Ukraine and Italy established diplomatic relations in 1992, soon after Ukraine independence from the <a href="Soviet%20Union">Soviet Union</a>. The Italian government supported the 2004 <a href="Orange%20Revolution">Orange Revolution</a> in Ukraine. Italy also supported Ukraine's claim to the <a href="Crimean%20Peninsula">Crimean Peninsula</a> over Russia's claim in the 2014 <a href="Crimean%20Crisis">Crimean Crisis</a>. 
Like other Western European countries, Italy has welcomed Ukraine's attempts in recent years to have closer ties to the <a href="European%20Union">European Union</a> and <a href="NATO">NATO</a>. Nevertheless, Italian-Ukrainian relations are not entirely harmonious. Italy opened and maintains informal diplomatic offices in the <a href="Donetsk%20People%27s%20Republic">Donetsk People's Republic</a> and the <a href="Luhansk%20People%27s%20Republic">Luhansk People's Republic</a>. The DPR and LPR declared independence from Ukraine in 2014 with the help of <a href="Russia">Russia</a>, however Ukraine considers them to be rebellious provinces whose declarations of independence lacked legal basis (see <a href="War%20in%20Donbass">War in Donbass</a> and <a href="Russo-Ukrainian%20War">Russo-Ukrainian War</a>). On a visit to Italy in February 2020, Ukrainian President <a href="Volodymyr%20Zelenskyy">Volodymyr Zelenskyy</a> urged Italian Prime Minister <a href="Giuseppe%20Conte">Giuseppe Conte</a> to shut down Italy's "illegal" diplomatic offices in the DPR and the LPR.
In addition to the Ukrainian embassy in Rome, Ukraine maintains <a href="consulate">consulates</a> in the Italian cities of <a href="Florence%2C%20Italy">Florence</a>, <a href="Bari%2C%20Italy">Bari</a>, and <a href="Milan%2C%20Italy">Milan</a>. Italy maintains an <a href="Embassy%20of%20Italy%2C%20Kyiv">embassy in the Ukrainian capital</a>, <a href="Kyiv">Kyiv</a>.
